main event: An Air Force Captain observed a bright, round, fuzzy object with a diameter of 20-30 feet in Colorado Springs, Colorado on November 6, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 30 minutes,First stationary for about 10 minutes before moving slowly east to west at an estimated speed of 5-10 mph,The sighting occurred under clear weather conditions with no wind,The investigation concluded that the object could not be identified as any known aircraft or satellite,There were two adult observers who also reported witnessing a light that changed colors from white to red to green.
witness description: Air Force Captain and one other adult observer
